NoteLiteral.En: The course is open to master students, there are no prerequisites regarding study background. The selection will be made based on your CV and a short motivation.

Description.En:
**Ready to Lead the Shift to a Circular Economy?**

The world is moving away from the wasteful linear economy toward a more sustainable, circular one, and it’s shaping the future of business. Engineers, business leaders, managers, and policy-makers are all needed to drive this change. Want to be one of the graduates leading the way? Circular Sustainable Business Development is the course for you! This exciting, multi-disciplinary course is open to all master’s students at UT.

**Why Circular Economy Matters**

In a world focused on sustainability, the circular economy is key to transforming how we produce and consume. As future decision-makers and leaders, it’s essential for students to understand the circular economy in relation to the triple bottom line: People (social impact), Planet (environmental impact), and Profit (economic viability). Through this course, you'll learn how to integrate these elements into business strategy and explore corporate social responsibility from all angles.

**What You’ll Learn**

The course kicks off with the basics of sustainable and circular economies, packed with real-world examples of success stories at the global, national, and regional levels. From there, you’ll work on a challenge-based group project (worth 25% of your grade) to tackle specific sustainability problems.

**Core Topics Covered:**

- **Sustainable Business Models:** Discover how companies can create value from an economic, environmental, and social perspective using the Triple Layered Business Model Canvas (BMC). This tool will allow you to think beyond just profits, incorporating life cycle and stakeholder perspectives.
- **Real-World Impact:** Explore how different sectors, from manufacturing to pharmaceuticals and agri-food, are affected by sustainability, and learn the techniques for measuring sustainability effectively.
- **Sustainability in Supply Chains:** You’ll dive into value recovery from end-of-life products and learn how businesses can shift from linear to circular models. A serious game simulating real-world decision-making will reinforce your learning (worth 25% of your grade). This game will take place at the campus of the University of Twente in Enschede, the Netherlands (see Participant information).
- **Hands-On Experience:** From Life Cycle Assessments to agent-based modeling and game theory, you’ll develop practical skills that will help you lead sustainable business practices.

**Engage with Big Ideas**

In the final weeks, you’ll explore cutting-edge topics driven by your own interests—like food waste, electronic waste management, or the evolution of eco-industrial parks. You’ll finish the course with a final individual written exam (worth 50% of your grade) that ties everything together.

This course is your gateway to becoming a key player in the circular economy transition. Ready to make an impact? Sign up for Circular Sustainable Business Development and start building the future!

Title.En: The learner can identify opportunities for business-making and value-recovery

NoteLiteral.En: The learner can identify opportunities for business-making and value-recovery in line with circular economy principles, particularly for industrial symbiosis cases.

Title.En: The learner can assess and evaluate the dynamic conditions influencing the decision-making

NoteLiteral.En: The learner can assess and evaluate the dynamic conditions influencing the decision-making and define managerial strategies for identified business opportunities in a real case

Title.En: The learner can implement circular economic business in a real case

NoteLiteral.En: The learner can implement circular economic business in a real case based on the identification and assessment outcomes

Title.En: The learner can monitor the sustainability of the implemented business over time

NoteLiteral.En: The learner can monitor the sustainability of the implemented business over time based on the decisions made in the assessment phase.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The challenge consists of a number of online theoretical lectures and a physical part. 

**Physical presence in Enschede, the Netherlands is required from Thursday 20 March until Friday 28 March. Ask for financial support from the mobility office of your home university, mentioning that this learning opportunity is eligible for BIP (Blended Intensive Program) Erasmus+ funding.**

We will start in the morning on Thursday 20 March, so you should arrive latest on Wednesday evening 19 March.

**Challenge schedule:**

- Monday 3 February until Wednesday 19 March: Online lectures
- Thursday 20 March until Friday 21 March: Industrial Symbiosis serious game preparation
- Saturday 22 March until Sunday 23: Free time to explore Enschede and the Netherlands
- Monday 23 March until Friday 28 March: Industrial Symbiosis serious game

**Challenge assessment:**

- Challenge-based short essay writing: 25% (group)
- Serious game: 25% (group)
- Written exam: 50% (individual)
Shape the future with a circular economy game!

Transition from unsustainable linear economy to sustainable circular economy is a top priority of our society. Future business models will be shaped according to the circularity of our resources, which will provide employment to a wide range of engineers (industrial, mechanical, design, construction, biotechnology, chemical, etc.), business administrators, managers, and policy-makers. Do you want to be a well-equipped graduate for this transition phase to circular economy? Then, Circular Sustainable Business Development is the right course for you!

This module requires min. 15 participants to be given. In case of lower participation, the module may have to be cancelled.

The course is open to master students, there are no prerequisites regarding study background. The selection will be made based on your CV and a short motivation. We will also aim for a nice balance of students across all ECIU universities.
